page.title: 10Courteenhall Hedgerows
page.content: Some of the ancient hedgrows have been removed in recent years in line with the current trend of enlarging field in order to maximise their crop potential, but many still remain. The hedges are made up of the following trees and bushes: Hawthorn, Sloe, Hazel, Ash, Oak, Field Maple, Blackberry and Elder. The base and surrounda of the hedge contains many wild flowers and countless different grasses. Amongst those present are White Clover, Yellow Creeping Cinquefoil, Meadow Buttercup, Coltsfoot, Sow Thistle, Hedge Parsley, Meadow Pea, Selfheal,Meadowsweet, Silverweed, Goose Grass, Scarlet Pimpernel, Bindweed, Nettles and Dock.
